DOC.brief_summary: To assess the safety of a sunscreen product under supervised outdoor-use conditions with the target consumer
DOC.brief_title: Outdoor-Use Test for Sunscreen Products in Children Ages 3 to 9 Years Old
DOC.criteria: Subject must be healthy, males or females between 3 to 9 years of age with no medical conditions of the skin. Subjects must have Fitzpatrick Skin Type I, II, III or IV. Subjects must agree to restrict their sun exposure activities for at least five days immediately preceding participation in the study. Subjects must not have actinic keratoses, skin cancer, psoriasis, eczema, or any other acute or chronic skin conditions. Subjects must not have visible erythema, blistering, or peeling that would indicate recent sunburn as determined by the baseline skin evaluation. Subjects must not have significantly tanned skin.
